result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Allan Addison

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court addresses atty fee payments. DE can start making them immediately. Court adjourned at 1:08 pm.

1:01 PM Aaron Allan Addison appears in Court,  Atty Philip A. Helgeson, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes judicial notice of Buffalo County Case #14CF11. Dep. Cole Clements. S/T. ADA Walker questions Deputy. Record reflects identification of the DE. Cross Atty Helgeson. ADA Walker is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:03 PM Aaron Allan Addison appears in Court, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes this was set for a PH. DE will call the PD to see if he qualifies. Court reviews DE's rights on PH. DE wishes to waive the time lines. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. ADA Walker would like to set a STC and has no objection for DE to call in on that date. Court adjourned at 1:09 pm.

3:09 PM Aaron Allan Addison appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Derek Sanders appears by phone,  ADA Joseph Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 Cash Bond w/conditions of Absolute Sobriety, Not to possess controlled substances & no firearms, objection. Court orders a $5,000.00 cash bond w/conditions requested. speedy Prelim demanded. DE will need to contact the PD's Office. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:22 pm.
